intro: Pterygodium ukingense, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Pterygodium ukingense make it an important species in ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
